intro: Iria pterigosperma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, velvety flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a distinctive central spot. Its leaves are thick, fleshy, and typically have a waxy texture, adapted to retain moisture in dry environments. Iria pterigosperma is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
